intro: Fleischmannia, commonly known as the desert star or desert bell, is a genus of flowering plants native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. These plants are members of the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and are characterized by their showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. Fleischmannia species are typically shrubs or small trees with thick, waxy leaves adapted to conserve water in harsh desert environments. They produce small, edible fruits that are often consumed by birds and small mammals, contributing to seed dispersal. The genus is known for its resilience to drought and extreme temperatures, making it well-suited for xeriscaping in dry climates.
